publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4539 Richard Lochhead: National Cycle Week - 17 to 25 June 2006—That the Parliament supports National Cycle Week, which takes place from 17 to 25 June 2006 and will encompass 1,500 events in which over 250,000 cyclists are expected to participate; congratulates the many local organisations in Scotland involved in National Cycle Week; further supports the aims of National Cycle Week which are to highlight cycling as a healthy and environmentally friendly form of transport and to encourage the increased use of cycling for travel, and recognises that cycling has an important role to play in meeting the targets for stabilising traffic at 2001 levels by 2021. Supported by: Donald Gorrie*

S2M-4539 Richard Lochhead: National Cycle Week - 17 to 25 June 2006—That the Parliament supports National Cycle Week, which takes place from 17 to 25 June 2006 and will encompass 1,500 events in which over 250,000 cyclists are expected to participate; congratulates the many local organisations in Scotland involved in National Cycle Week*, and* further supports the aims of National Cycle Week which are to highlight cycling as a healthy and environmentally friendly form of transport and to encourage the increased use of cycling for travel* *. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Rob Gibson*, Fergus Ewing*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Bruce Crawford*, Jim Mather*, Murray Tosh*, Alex Neil*, Michael Matheson*, Robin Harper*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Alasdair Morgan*, Ms Maureen Watt*, Eleanor Scott*, Mike Pringle*, Mr John Swinney*, Mark Ballard*
S2M-4539 National Cycle Week - 17 to 25 June 2006 (lodged on 13 June 2006) Nora Radcliffe*, Chris Ballance*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Shiona Baird*, Dave Petrie*

S2M-4539 Richard Lochhead: National Cycle Week - 17 to 25 June 2006—That the Parliament supports National Cycle Week, which takes place from 17 to 25 June 2006 and will encompass 1,500 events in which over 250,000 cyclists are expected to participate; congratulates the many local organisations in Scotland involved in National Cycle Week, and further supports the aims of National Cycle Week which are to highlight cycling as a healthy and environmentally friendly form of transport and to encourage the increased use of cycling for travel. Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Rob Gibson, Fergus Ewing, Roseanna Cunningham, Bruce Crawford, Jim Mather, Murray Tosh, Alex Neil, Michael Matheson, Robin Harper, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Alasdair Morgan, Ms Maureen Watt, Eleanor Scott, Mike Pringle, Mr John Swinney, Mark Ballard, Nora Radcliffe, Chris Ballance, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Shiona Baird, Dave Petrie, Mr Mark Ruskell*
S2M-4539 National Cycle Week - 17 to 25 June 2006 (lodged on 13 June 2006) Mr David Davidson*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-4539 National Cycle Week - 17 to 25 June 2006 (lodged on 13 June 2006) Dr Elaine Murray*, Sarah Boyack*
S2M-4539 National Cycle Week - 17 to 25 June 2006 (lodged on 13 June 2006) Scott Barrie*
